Description: Fragment of upper front or back of a tunic; Mainly undyed, plain weave linen with wool shoulder stripes/clavi made up of small, tapestry woven (grouped warp threads), dotted flowers and leaves in dark blue, yellow, dark pink and pale blue; Clavi bordered by pairs of self-bands in linen; Edge at neck bound with a strip of matching linen, traces of seam at waist; Warp: linen, S spun, c.22 tpc; Weft: linen and wool, pale blue and yellow Z spun, dark blue and pink S spun, c.17 tpc in plain areas and c.50-60 tpc in tapestry; Edges: plain selvedge at waist, selvedge at neck now hidden, other edges ragged; Sewing: traces S spun Z ply linen
Curator's comments: Previous location Cupboard 64, red box; Part of a woven-to-shape tunic. Information from Hero Granger-Taylor (6.6.1990)
Condition: Mixed; good in areas; stuck to sticky net (date unknown)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Maj William Joseph Myers (executors of)
